snippet: The Romney and Obama campaigns spent the day weighing in on Hilary Rosen’s remark that Ann Romney had “never worked a day in her life.”
abstract: Romney and Obama campaigns undergo dramatic back-and-forth after Democratic strategist Hilary Rosen says Ann Romney has 'never worked a day in her life,' and that she is out of touch with the concerns of working mothers; controversial comment cuts to the core of divisive issues concerning women's rights and income inequality that may play a decisive role in the general election.

byline.original: By MICHAEL D. SHEAR and SUSAN SAULNY

lead_paragraph: The Romney and Obama campaigns spent the day weighing in on Hilary Rosen’s remark that Ann Romney had “never worked a day in her life.”

headline.seo: Hilary Rosen’s Comments Spark Campaign Debate
headline.main: Collision Over Roles of Women Sets Off Combative Debate Along the Trail
headline.print_headline: Collision Over Roles of Women Sets Off Combative Debate Along the Trail
